Seal characters (1)

蹠字的基本解释

蹠
zhí
脚面上接近脚趾的部分：蹠骨。
脚掌。

蹠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhí］
［《廣韻》之石切，入昔，章。］
亦作“1”。亦作“跖1”。
(1)足跟；脚掌。
(2)腿脚。
(3)踩；践踏。
(4)用以表示乘，登。
(5)跳跃。
(6)往；到达。
(7)愿。
(8)耸立。
(9)古人名。指盗跖。
(10)后泛指强盗。

蹠字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　蹠； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1232第29
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】?之石切，音隻。【說文】楚人謂跳躍曰蹠。【揚子·方言】楚曰蹠。自關而西，秦晉之閒曰跳。　又【廣韻】足履踐也。【史記·蘇秦傳】被堅甲，蹠勁弩。【前漢·揚雄傳】蹠彭咸之所遺。【註】蹠，蹈也。【楚辭·九章】眇不知其所蹠。【註】蹠，踐也。　又【淮南子·原道訓】自無蹠有。【註】蹠，適也。　又【玉篇】同跖。【戰國策】蹠穿膝暴。【註】蹠，足下。【淮南子·主術訓】則蹠蹻之姦。【註】盜蹠。　又【集韻】章恕切，音翥。義同。　又職略切，音灼。與趵同。跡也。

Plantar
Basic explanation of words
Plantar
zhí
The part of the foot near the toe: the metatarsal bones.
Sole.
Plantar
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhí］
[The stone cut of "Guangyun", into the past, chapter. ]
Also known as "1". Also known as "plantar 1".
(1) Heel; sole.
(2) Legs and feet.
(3) Trample; trample.
(4) It is used to express multiplication and boarding.
(5) Jump.
(6) To; to arrive.
(7) Willing.
(8) Towering.
(9) Ancient names. Refers to theft.
(10) Later refers to robbers.
Plantar
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Foot Character Department] 　跖; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1232 29
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Stone cut, sound only. [Said the text] Chu people said that jumping is plantar. 【Yangtze Dialect】Chu said plantar. From the Guan to the west, the Qin and Jin dynasties called jumping.　[Guang Yun] Foot and foot practice also. [Historical Records·Su Qin Biography] Was hard-armed, planted on a crossbow. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong Biography] The legacy of Peng Xian. [Note] Plantar, dance also. [Songs of the Chu Nine Chapters] I don't know what it is. [Note] Plantar, practice also.　[Huainanzi·Yuan Daoxun] There is no such thing. [Note] Plantar, suitable.　[Jade articles] are the same. [Warring States Policy] Plantar through the knee violent. [Note] Plantar, one step. 【Huainanzi·Master Training】is the traitor of plantars. [Note] Pirate the plantar.　[Jiyun] Zhang Shuqie, Yinzhu. The same meaning.　The job is slightly cut again, and the sound is burned. Same as Bao. Trace also.
